title: fix triplet margin loss documentation
body_html: Hi all! The documentation of the triplet margin loss suggests that the squared euclidean distances are used, but in practice the true euclidean distances are used. This can cause confusion as in some algorithms that use triplets (e.g. Large Margin Nearest Neighbor), the squared distances are actually used.

body: Hi all! The documentation of the triplet margin loss suggests that the squared euclidean distances are used, but in practice the true euclidean distances are used. This can cause confusion as in some algorithms that use triplets (e.g. Large Margin Nearest Neighbor), the squared distances are actually used.
